page.title: 13Near Grantham:Welby Warren
page.content: Welby Warren is a typical farm on this heathland area east of Grantham.The extensive farm buildings are not actually lived in; the tenant farmer lives several miles away in Newton.There is virtually no livestock at present(late 1985)The main crops are wheat, borage,evening primrose, sugar beet,oil seed rape and barley.The farm is very well supplied with farm machinery.There is a combine harvester,tractors,crop sprayers,lorries,silos and other storage machinery,a grain elevator and other cultivation equipment.The soil is very light and is fairly easy to work and it drains easily being on limestone.The land usage has changed in the last ten years away from grass land because the light soil is so much better for arable farming.
